and I will remove your name from the list...

[The right use of today is the best preparation for tomorrow]

01/02/10~~~food for thought~~~A NEW YEAR BUT THE SAME PARDON...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
I will forgive their wickedness and will remember
their sins no more...(Jer. 31:34)

Our Lesson for Today:
What can you do with that water stain on the ceiling?
Try covering it with ordinary paint, but it still bleeds through.
Buy the special paint made to cover such stains, but you still see
its faint outline each time you look at the ceiling...

Don't we sometimes act as if God deals the same way with our sins?
Don't we sometimes act as if Jesus merely covered them over and yet they're still there?

Why? Didn't you notice what the gracious Lord said? He does more than cover our sins ~
He removes them. He doesn't even remember our sins. Our sins are gone as if they never
existed. All because He sent His Son to pay for them on Calvary's cross...

Thank God we don't have to enter the new year with the stains of last year's sins upon us.
They're totally gone ~ blotted out completely by the precious blood of the Savior.
Oh yes there will be sins in this new year too ~ there will be plenty of them.
Old familiar ones that we fight against and yet fall back into. New ones that we stumble into
because they sneak up on us. What shall we do, what can we do, with all their wretched stains?

The same thing we did last year. Bring them with tears of repentance to God, and thank Him
each day of this new year for forgiving our sins and remembering them no more...

Prayer Suggestion:
Thank You, Lord, for Your forgiveness that 
remains new for us each day...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life, no one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6

Yet, we rejoice in Your promise that You do not merely cover our transgressions, but You remove them completely, as far as the east is from the west. Lord, we thank You for the precious blood of Your Son, Jesus, which cleanses us from all unrighteousness. May we walk in the freedom of Your forgiveness, ever mindful of Your steadfast love and compassion. Amen.

01/03.10~~~food for thought~~~A NEW YEAR BUT THE SAME PEACE...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
The Lord gives His people strength.
The Lord blesses them with peace...(Ps. 29:11)

Our Lesson for Today:
How many of us know about threats and stress?
How many of us have carried burdens from the old year into the new?
How many of us have found that these burdens seem to pick up more weight day by day?
And who knows what new problems will drop down on our shoulders tomorrow?

What's the solution?
Where can we find release from our fears and relaxation under our burdens?
There's only one place ~ one person ~ the Lord.
He who prepared in Jesus the perfect peace we need for our souls 
will also provide what we need for our daily lives...

With our eyes on such a loving Lord, we can go forward even though the steps are painful.
We can smile even in the midst of tears.
If with hearts of faith, we lay our burdens before God, the result will always be peace...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, Help me to fasten my heart on Your gracious promise
and fill my life with Your peace...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord is my strength, my shield from every danger.
I trust in Him with all my heart...(Ps. 29:7)

He who prepared in Jesus the perfect peace we need for our souls will also provide what we need for our daily lives. Yet, we find comfort in Your promise of perfect peace for our souls, as revealed in Your Son, Jesus Christ. Lord, we lay our burdens at Your feet, trusting that You will provide for our daily needs and grant us the peace that surpasses all understanding. May our eyes remain fixed on Your loving presence, that we may walk forward with faith, even in the midst of tears. Amen.

12/04/10~~~food for thought~~~A NEW YEAR BUT THE SAME POWER...

Our Bible verse for Today:
Be strong in the Lord and His mighty power...(Eph. 6:10)

Our Lesson for Today:
Those rust nails wouldn't budge. I finally, reach for my 'power bar,' which has
a much longer handle. The nails finally let go and one by one came out of
the board. My 'power bar' gave me the extra power I needed...

None of us are strangers to temptation. Each of us has his own area of weakness
that the sly devil explores and the sinful world exploits. And the evil hearts within 
us never sleep or give up the struggle. You know what I'm talking about???

How long would the list be if we were to catalog the soft spots where temptations
sink in so easily? ~ How many times have we been pinned to the mat of sin
by the old evil foe instead of winning the match???

Will it get any better this new year?
Will our struggle against sin be more successful?
Not if we use only the puny hammer of our own efforts.
More power is needed.
And the Lord Jesus offers us that added power...
"[He] appeared...to destroy the devils work," Scripture tells us...(1 Jn. 3:8)

Not only has God's Son paid for our sins, but He has also broken Satan's
stranglehold on us. When Satan is successful in our lives, it's not because 
Christ's power has failed. BUT it is because our hold on His 'power bar' isn't 
as firm as it should be...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, tighten my grip on Your Word through
which You give my faith Your mighty power...Amen.

In the new year take time to be holy. Let the world rush on...


Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

01/05/10~~~food for thought~~~A NEW YEAR BUT THE SAME PROMISE...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
If I go to prepare and place for you, I will come back and
take you to be with Me that you also may be where I am...(Jn. 14:3)

Our Lesson for Today:
Jesus' words show that the way to eternal life, though unseen, is secure ~
as secure as your trust in Jesus, He has already prepared the way to eternal 
life. The only issue that may still be unsettled is your willingness to believe...

The verse that we have today has two rich promises:
"I am going to prepare a place for you." And,
"I will come back and get you."

Yes we can look forward to eternal life because Jesus has answered
that question so clearly to us. The only way is through His blood that
has cleansed us from all sin and His righteousness clothes us for 
heaven.

That's His promise, and it holds true into a new year and into all eternity...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, keep us ready for heaven by covering us
with your blood and righteousness...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6

We thank You for His sacrifice that has cleansed us from sin and clothed us in His righteousness, making us worthy to dwell in Your presence. Lord, may our hearts be filled with the assurance of Your love and the hope of the life to come, as we eagerly await the day when You will come and take us to the place You have prepared. In Jesus' name, Amen.

01/06/10~~~food for thought~~~A NEW YEAR BUT THE SAME STAR...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
We saw His star in the east and have come to worship Him...(Mt. 2:2)

Our Lesson for Today:
We don't know much about the Magi. Scripture doesn't reveal what country they 
came from, how many there were, what occupations or names they had. What
we need to know about them, though, the biblical account has recorded... 

They were led by some mysterious star ~ "His" star ~ right to Jesus' side.
and when the Magi saw their infant Savior, they knew what to do.
They knelt down and worshiped Him...

The Magi were the first in a long line of Gentiles brought to the Savior, a line that
by God's grace includes us also. They were led by a star. Our star is even better.
"You word is a lamp to my feet and a light for my path," the psalmist wrote (119:105),
and we would heartily agree."We have seen His star," we say with the Magi, not in
the east, but, better still, in His Word.

Now the Lord has given us a new year in which to be guided by His Word to the Savior.
Modern Magi know where their eyes belong ~ on God's wondrous star...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help us to live in Your Holy Word,
and to see our Savior there...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6

prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that You have revealed Your Son, our Savior, to the nations. As the Magi were led by Your guiding star, may we be led by the light of Your Word, a lamp to our feet and a light for our path. Grant us the wisdom and humility to kneel before Jesus and worship Him as our King. In this new year, may we follow where Your Word leads, that we may find our hearts' true home in You. Amen.

01/07/10~~~food for thought~~~THANK GOD FOR THIS SNOW

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Though your sins are like scarlet, they shall be as white as snow...(Isa. 1:18)

Our Lesson for Today:
Some people like snow, at least the first snow of the winter.
The beautiful white flakes cover earth's dead vegetation and everything looks so pure.
But when snow keeps coming or shows up in spring, the grumbling begins...

Thank God for this snow. How could we get up and start another day without
the promise of His forgiveness? ~ How could we go to bed each night without
the assurance, "Were as scarlet my transgression, it shall be as white as snow
by Your blood and bitter passion" (Christian Worship 304:6)?

Even more, how could we ever face eternity, where we need to be white as snow
in the Judge's sight? ~ Regardless of where we live or how many snowflakes we
see each winter, we can never get to much of this snow...

Prayer Suggestion:
Cover me, Lord, with Your Son's forgiveness that
I might be pure in Your sight...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6

Even more, how could we ever face eternity, where we need to be white as snow in the Judge's sight? ~ Regardless of where we live or how many snowflakes we see each winter, we can never get to much of this snow.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the promise of forgiveness and the assurance that our sins, though scarlet, can be made as white as snow through the blood and sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Help us to cling to this hope, even as the snow falls and the world around us grows cold. May we ever seek to be cleansed and purified in Your sight, that we may stand before You without fear on the day of judgment. In Your name we pray, Amen.

01/08/10~~~food for thought~~~THE DIVINE WEATHERMAN...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
He sends the snow like white wool...(Ps. 147:16a)

Our Lesson for Today:
It goes without saying that the psalmist knew who made it snow ~ so do we...
When the road home from work is snow covered and slippery, the driveway
plugged by the passing snowplow, the side walk almost buried under the drifting 
snow, do we stop to think who sent the it???

If we have to start the snowblower and do the shoveling we're not to tickled.
Next time it snows, stop for a moment and consider the hand behind it. Remember
its the hand of our almighty God. ~ He alone fills the clouds with moisture ~ forms 
the snow flakes ~ and sends them fluttering down...

It's our all-knowing God who waters the fields ~ fills the reservoirs ~ and provides for 
His creatures. His divine hand sends not only the snow but everything else good for
His children...

Yes from this divine weatherman we look for weather that is always ~ "fair."
But remember for the flowers we appreciate so much there must also be rain...
Difficulties strengthen our faith as labor does the body...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to see your hand at work in the
changing seasons of my life, help me to appreciate
the fact that if it was always fair, my faith would not
be as strong as it is...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6

prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your mighty power that sends the snow and fills the clouds with moisture. You alone control the weather and provide for all Your creatures. When the snow covers the ground, may we remember Your loving hand that cares for us and strengthens our faith, even in life's difficulties. May we always trust in Your perfect plan and give You thanks for Your good gifts. Amen.

01/09/10~~~food for thought~~~MAY THE SNOW DO IT'S JOB...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
As the rain and the snow come down from heaven, and do not return to it
without watering the earth and making it bud and flourish ~ so is my word
that goes out from my mouth: It will not return to Me empty, but will accomplish
what I desire and achieve the purpose for which I sent it...(Isa. 55:10, 11)

Our lesson for Today:
A pastor who had shared God's Word finally gave up, because the person 
continually rejected him. Then weeks after giving up, his phone rang, it was the
very same person asking to join the church. What he couldn't do, the Lord had
done. The young pastor had learned a valuable lesson. His job was to share the 
Word; the Lord's job was to make it work in the human heart...

Just as God decides where and when the snow will fall, so He determines where
and when His Word will bring dead hearts to faith. If only we could see the Holy
Spirit at work through that powerful Word, we would be more encouraged in our
attempts to share it...

Since we can't we need to remember this important truth: Our job is to share the 
snow, (word) not to make it grow...

So let it snow! on your relatives, neighbors, friends, coworkers fellow students 
whoever. They need the life-giving message of their only Savior from sin and
only deliverer from death...

Into our hands God has placed His Word. In His hands rests the results He
has promised...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I ask Your blessing upon our sharing of Your powerful Word.
Use it to bring dead hearts to life. And give us the patients to wait on the results...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6

His job was to share the Word; the Lord's job was to make it work in the human heart. Just as God decides where and when the snow will fall, so He determines where and when His Word will bring dead hearts to faith. original_verse_text: As the rain and the snow come down from heaven, and do not return to it without watering the earth and making it bud and flourish ~ so is my word that goes out from my mouth: It will not return to Me empty, but will accomplish what I desire and achieve the purpose for which I sent it.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the power of Your Word, which is living and active, able to transform even the hardest of hearts. Help us to faithfully share the good news of salvation through Jesus Christ, trusting that You will work in the lives of those who hear it. May Your Spirit move mightily, bringing dead hearts to life and drawing all people to Yourself. Lord, may Your Word continue to 'snow' upon our world, bringing the life-giving message of hope and redemption. We commit our efforts to You, for the results are in Your hands. Amen.
reflection: A pastor who had shared God's Word finally gave up, because the person continually rejected him. Then weeks after giving up, his phone rang, it was the very same person asking to join the church. What he couldn't do, the Lord had done. The young pastor had learned a valuable lesson. His job was to share the Word; the Lord's job was to make it work in the human heart. Just as God decides where and when the snow will fall, so He determines where and when His Word will bring dead hearts to faith. If only we could see the Holy Spirit at work through that powerful Word, we would be more encouraged in our attempts to share it. Since we can't we need to remember this important truth: Our job is to share the snow, (word) not to make it grow. So let it snow! on your relatives, neighbors, friends, coworkers fellow students whoever. They need the life-giving message of their only Savior from sin and only deliverer from death. Into our hands God has placed His Word. In His hands rests the results He has promised.
subject: The Snow That Grows
verse_text: As the rain and the snow come down from heaven, and do not return to it without watering the earth and making it bud and flourish ~ so is my word that goes out from my mouth: It will not return to Me empty, but will accomplish what I desire and achieve the purpose for which I sent it.

01/10/10~~~food for thought~~~OUR ORDERS REMAIN UNCHANGED...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Go into all the world and preach the good news to all creation...(Mk. 16:15)

Our Lesson for Today:
Every hour on the hour, 365 days a year, a soldier reports for duty at the Tomb
of the Unknown Soldier in Arlington National Cemetery. The precision of the changing
of the guard is impressive. Even more impressive are the orders handed on. Always
the command is the same, "Orders remain unchanged."

Shouldn't we say the same about the command the risen Savior has given His
soldiers of all times? "Go," he charged, "into all the world." "Preach the good news,"
He commanded, "to all creation." "And when you have done it," He continued, "pass
the order onto those who follow you."

The orders of the day for believers are always the same, Not to guard a tomb in which 
an unknown body rests but to tell all creation of their living, loving Savior, their only Savior...

So soldiers of the cross, how goes it? ~ Whom have you told? You say, "I can't reach very far."
Well then, how about your family, your neighborhood, your small corner of the world?"
"I can't do very much!" you excuse...Well then, how about your prayers and dollars for missions?

We may never cross oceans to distant worlds. But we can build boats that carry those who go.
and we can fish in lakes right in our own backyards...

Prayer Suggestion:
Lord, here I am. Move me, use me, and bless my efforts
to tell others about You...Amen.


Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
Do not let your hearts be troubled. 
Trust in God; trust also in Me." (Jn. 14:1)

01/11/10~~~food for thought~~~SAFE IN OUR FATHER'S ARMS...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
God is our refuge and strength, always ready to help
in times of trouble...(Ps 46:1)

Our lesson for Today:
In the following verses the psalmist writes about the fear of earthquakes and such.
Today people fear terrorist attacks and the economy crumbling and such...

But the psalmist says even if the world ends, we need not fear. In the face of complete 
destruction, the writer expressed a quiet confidence in God's ability to save him. Yes,
it does seem impossible to consider the end of the world without becoming consumed
by fear but the Bible is clear ~ God is our refuge even in the midst of total destruction.

He is not merely a temporary retreat: He is our eternal refuge and can provide strength 
in any circumstance...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I am weak, but You are strong. Carry me
each day and into the eternal day...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6
It is not how long but how well we live that matters...

01/12.10~~~food for thought~~~ALWAYS IN FASHION...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
It seems that the thing most talked about for the coming year in fashions is,
how long or short will the dresses be, what colors will be in, what about accessories? 
Will men's suits be double breasted, or have three buttons...

Christians know something about proper dress. In fact, only Christians know
about the right clothing for heaven. The garments of salvation are not union made
but divinely tailored. They carry no dry-cleaning labels but are always pressed
and spotless...

They are not made for hanging in the closet but for everyday wear. And they are
the only dress that gets us into heaven's party. At our baptism God clothed us with 
the garments of His salvation. By His grace, Christ's forgiveness covered us and
His holiness counted for us...

Through His Word, as we hear and read it, He wraps that beautiful robe more tightly
around us and fastens its buttons more securely. When our final day comes, it will
be His doing that we can step "clothed in His righteousness alone, faultless to
stand before His throne."

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord Jesus, please let Your blood and righteousness
by my beauty and my glorious dress...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6

Today is the tomorrow you worried about yesterday...

01/13/2010~~~food for thought~~~FOREVER IN HIS CHAIR...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
The One enthroned in heaven laughs; the Lord scoffs at them. (Ps. 2:4)

Our Lesson for Today:
What's a person to do? The world in which we have to live and breath is
becoming increasingly polluted. All around us ~ in movies and TV ~ in adds
and commercials ~ and even within some churches, beats the appealing
chant that man can have it all ~ do it all ~ ignore it all. SO what are we supposed
to do???

Do we just shrug our shoulders and ask what else is new? ~ Do we just throw in 
the towel and surrender? Do we just say, thank God we have gray hair and won't
see what our grandchildren will have to face??? 

Or should we join David in today's verse? He raised his face to heaven, and what 
he saw comforted him. The sinful efforts of the world aren't enough to make the 
One who sits on heaven's throne even leave His seat...

Their feeble attempts to war against Him and His own are only enough to make Him
laugh. The Almighty Ruler of all has never heard anything so humorous as man's empty 
boasting. He's never seen anything so funny as mankind's incompetent attempts to 
get along without Him...

Yes we must all agree, times are evil. But we're not going to give up. Why should we?
We're going to win! He who sits in the heavens is laughing, and we with Him. His Word
still stands. His ways will still endure. And when the dust settles in the future as in the 
past, it will be victory that we shall see...

Prayer Suggestion:
Almighty God, fix our faith on You so that we have
comfort in the midst of life's turmoil...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6

01/14/2010~~~food for thought~~~JUST ANOTHER DAY?

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Whatever you do, whether in word or deed, do it all in the name
of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through Him.
(Col. 3:17)

Our Lesson for Today:
How ordinary life can seem. Day after day we get up, clean up, and hurry up,
off to the duties of another day. Then we return home, have supper, clean up
the kitchen, watch some TV, and head back to bed. But don't forget to set the
alarm, because tomorrow it starts all over again...

But for Christians it should never be just another day. Because each day the Lord
gives us golden opportunities to serve Him ~ to show our appreciation for the eternal
life that He has already given us...

Just as a hot dog without mustard doesn't taste right, so life without Christ has no zip.
But add the Savior and life takes on new meaning. The "just another day" becomes
another day to serve Him in grateful love...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, take our moments and our days,
let them flow in ceaseless praise...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6

Remember ~ hold our e-mail until the 20th...

01/15/2010~~~food for thought~~~THE ONLY BREAD...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
I am the bread of live. He who comes to Me will never go hungry. (Jn. 6:35)


Our Lesson for Today:
Like our body, our soul needs bread or it will die. But unlike our bodies,
stuff that looks like bread will not do the job. Some set before the
hungry soul the loaves of man's own works. But such bread does not
contain the vitamins of forgiveness...

Others serve up the packaged loaves of man's own theology. But such
bread is full of holes, holding no sure promise of an eternal home. Where
do you find good bread? The hungry soul needs to know...

In Jesus! When He described Himself as the bread of life, He had more
than flour, shortening, and water in mind. He meant His perfect life that would
fulfill all of God's commands and His precious blood that would be spilt in full
payment for all sins...

The soul, famished because of sin, can feast on Jesus' payment and be filled.
The soul, hungry for a perfect life to present to God in the judgement, can reach 
for Jesus' righteousness and be satisfied. For the hungry sinner, Jesus is not
just good bread. He is the only bread...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord Jesus, help me to feast on You
through my use of Your Word...Amen. 

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6

01/21/2010~~~food for thought~~~HE KNOWS ME...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
"How do you know me?" Nathaniel asked. Jesus answered,
"I saw you while you were still under the fig tree before Philip
called you." Then Nathanael declared, "Rabbi, You are the Son
of God; You are the King of Israel." (Jn. 1:48, 49)

Our Lesson for Today:
The two had never met before that day. Yet the One knew the other perfectly.
Jesus knew Nathaniel's name and character, what he had been doing, and
what he needed... Sound familiar???

Jesus knows us too. He knows the sudden sins that sweep down on us like a 
tornado. He knows the wreckage they leave on our conscience. and He knows
the daily sins that are as close to us as our skin ~ that we don't always recognize 
as wrong...

Like Nathanael, who was looking for the Savior to come, we need Jesus. And He
knows this. So He speaks to us through His Word. He tells us that He forgives us 
because He's already paid for our sins...

Like Nathanael, its time for us to say joyfully, and thankfully, "Jesus, You are the Son
of God, my eternal King, my beloved Savior."

Prayer Suggestion:
Thank You, Jesus, for being my Savior and for the
heaven you have waiting for me...Amen 
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6

01/22/2010~~~food for thought~~~WHAT DOES JESUS HAVE TO SAY?

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"The time has come." He said."The kingdom of God is near.
Repent and believe the Good News!" (Mk. 1:5)

Our Lesson for Today:
What Jesus has to say can be summed up with four Rs.

He tells us to realize that we have sinned ~ More times than we can count,
more ways than we can remember.

He tells us to regret that we have sinned ~ Not just to mouth the words "I'm sorry"
but to hang our heads in shame before our Holy Father.

Then He tells us to rely on His full forgiveness to cover those sins ~ To find in Him
the pardon we need and the peace to stand before our loving Father again.

Last of all, He tells us to resolve to fight against our sins ~ Not just take His pardon
and run but to promise with His power to amend our sinful lives...

Remember there is no shelf life on Jesus' message of repentance. What He has to 
say never goes out of date regardless of how many new years come. Sinners like
you and me need to hear again and again His important words, "Repent and believe 
the Good News."

Dear Lord, open my ears to hear and my heart
to receive Your Good News...Amen.

Then He tells us to rely on His full forgiveness to cover those sins ~ To find in Him the pardon we need and the peace to stand before our loving Father again. Last of all, He tells us to resolve to fight against our sins ~ Not just take His pardon and run but to promise with His power to amend our sinful lives. Remember there is no shelf life on Jesus' message of repentance. What He has to say never goes out of date regardless of how many new years come. Sinners like you and me need to hear again and again His important words, "Repent and believe the Good News."

01/23/2010~~~food for thought~~~PART OF THE FAMILY...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Whoever does the will of My Father in heaven is my
brother and sister and mother...(Mt. 12:50)

Our Lesson for Today:
Jesus tells us."Whoever does the will of My Father in heaven," 
He says, "Is my brother and sister and mother." What does He mean with
"does the will of My Father in heaven"? Guest what He tells us that too.
In John 6:40 He explains, "My Father's will is that everyone who looks to the 
Son and believes in Him shall have eternal life."

So the heavenly Father's dearest wish is that everyone recognize Jesus as 
His own Son sent from heaven to pay for the sins of us all so that we can live
with Him forever...

To put it another way, He wants us to believe that only Jesus can turn us from
enemies into beloved family members...

In earthly families, blood bonds us together. In Christ's family, it is faith, the 
gift of the Holy Spirit. When God brings us to faith in His Son as our only Savior,
we're Jesus' brother or sister or mother. I'm a dear family member, closer to
Him than anyone else, sure of sharing His home in heaven...How about you?

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, bond me into Your eternal family by giving me
faith in You as my only Savior...Amen
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

01/24/2010~~~ OUR PRIVILEGE...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
With My authority take this message of repentance to all the nations,
beginning in Jerusalem: 'There is forgiveness of sins for all people
who turn to Me.' You are My witnesses of all these things...(Lk. 24:47, 48)

Our Lesson for Today:
As members of Christ's family, we have a responsibilities. Or perhaps we should
call them privileges. They are efforts we should put forward in a willing, grateful
response to what the Savior has done for our salvation...

Of course, such actions cover our whole lives. We want everything in word and 
deed to be done to His glory. But one privilege stands out above all others. That's 
the work the risen Savior has given us ~ to be His witnesses. We who have seen
His cross and empty tomb need to tell others. We need to share with the needy the 
Good News of the forgiveness of sins...

On the job??? Perhaps we can't all become a pastor or a teacher. Perhaps we can't 
all fly to distant continents or move to expanding areas of our country. But we can
still witness. We can tell the child on our lap, we can tell the neighbor down the street,
we can tell a coworker on the job about the Jesus who loves them. We can speak our 
prayers and we can bring our offerings for the spreading of the gospel...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, move me, use me, bless me...Amen

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the father except through Me." - John: 14:6

01/25/2010~~~food for thought~~~MY FRIEND BRINGS ME TRUE JOY...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
On the third day a wedding took place at Cana in Galilee. Jesus' mother was there,
and Jesus and His disciples were invited to the wedding...(Jn. 2:1, 2)

Our Lesson for Today:
Did you know that Jesus' first recorded miracle was at a wedding celebration?
He had just begun His ministry, just been baptized in the Jordan, just been
tempted in the wilderness, just called His first disciples, when we find Him at
a wedding reception? He was busy, as we can well imagine, but not to busy to
accept the invitation of this bride and groom. As a friend he was there rejoicing 
with them and even increasing their joy with His miracle of changing water into wine...

Dose this tell us something about the Christian? The world has it all wrong.
Believers are not the gloomiest; they are the happiest people on earth. Who
but the Christian can have real joy in this sin-muddied world? Only a life that
is faith filled, and hope filled can be a joyous one. And such a joyous life is
found in Christ, our heavenly Friend...

When His forgiveness fills our lives and His love colors our days, smiles, not frowns,
are in place. When our heavenly Friend stands beside us at our celebrations and 
in our daily lives, our smiles are heightened and our joys brightened...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, fill my heart with joy and my life with
smiles through Your presence...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6

01/26/2010~~~food for thought~~~A CHILD OF GOD...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
How great is the love the Father has lavished on us, that we
should be called children of God! (1 Jn. 3:1a)

Our Lesson for Today:
What is the greatest blessing we enjoy in our earthly families?
It's love, isn't it? If love is absent, we can have the best of food
and clothing, you name it, and yet we have nothing...

As believers, our self-worth is based on the fact that God loves us
and calls us His children. YES we are His children now, not sometime 
in the distant future...

Yes, we are members of God's family, His children.
And, knowing that we are His children should encourage 
us to live as Jesus did.

The Christian life is a process of becoming more and more 
like Christ. (Ro 8:29)

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to grow day by day in the likeness
of Your Son...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

01/27/2010~~~food for thought~~~HANDS GREAT ENOUGH TO FULFILL ANY NEED...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
Jesus said to the servants, "Fill the jars with water;" so they filled them
to the brim. Then He told them, "Now draw some out and take it to the
master of the banquet." They did so, and the master of the banquet
tasted the water that had been turn into wine...(Jn. 2:7-9)

Our lesson for Today:
At this wedding it wasn't long before some needs arose. To us the lack of wine
may not seem serious, but to this bridegroom and bride it meant embarrassment. 
But the heavenly guest took care of their need. When the servants carried the cupful 
from the water-fill jars to the caterer of the feast, it was obvious what Jesus had done.
Miraculously that cup now contained wine far better wine than what the bridegroom had
originally provided...

Want to talk about needs? How can we help it? Daily life is filled with them. What can we 
do about those large ones, like the stain cause by sin, the pressures of those special 
sins, the weaknesses when it comes to daily temptations???

Where can we turn with those lesser and yet weighty cares, like a loved one in the
hospital, a wayward child in our home, a job on shaky ground???

Let the miracle at Cana remind us! Jesus first miracle was not to stop pain or heal
a disease but to make wine at a wedding, as a reminder that our needs, big or small, 
are seen and satisfied by Him...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord Jesus, remind me that Your hands are strong
enough to handle all my needs...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6

01/28/2010~~~food for thought~~~MY FRIEND STRENGTHENS MY FAITH...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
This, the first of His miraculous signs, Jesus performed in Cana
of Galilee. He thus revealed His glory, and His disciples put their
faith in Him...(Jn. 2:11)

Our Lesson for Today:
Far greater than the miracle of water turned into wine was the invisible
miracle that day at the wedding. As always Jesus' miracles were not to
make a grand display of Himself or dazzle those around Him. They were
intended as signs to point sinners to Him for the greater needs of their souls...

The miracles were powerful displays of His ability to rescue the people from
sin, death, and the devil. Though many missed the point, His disciples at Cana
that day didn't. Here is what we read of them, "His disciples put their faith in Him."

See what this heavenly friend did for them. He strengthened their faith. He became
closer and dearer to them, more precious and glorious than ever before...

Do we want our faith and friendship with Jesus strengthened? There is a way,
one that the world despises and that even some lukewarm friends of Jesus at 
times disregards. As we hear His Holy Word in our churches and read it at home,
He sends His Spirit to renew our faith. As we receive the Lord's Supper at His altar, 
He refreshes our hearts. And through the miracle of Holy Baptism, He makes and 
then reminds us of His promise that we are His and He is ours forever...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I invite You as a guest of my heart and home
with Your straightening of my faith...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

01/29/2010~~~food for thought~~~NEVER TO THIRST AGAIN...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Whoever drinks the water I give him will never thirst...(Jn. 4:14)

Our Lesson for Today:
Though many do not feel it or admit it, their souls beg for relief from the
burning anguish of sin. In their ignorance and stubbornness, they turn to
the world's wells. But like an alcoholic, the more they drink the less their
thirst is quenched...

Instead of labeling these wells as "unsafe for human consumption,"
Satan disguises the spouts to deceive the thirsty traveler. But the time
comes when the wells of power, possession, pleasure, and philosophy,
where people have let down their buckets of an extravagant life style, will
come to find that it is only poison for their soul...

There is only one well that can quench the soul's thirst. Jesus said it clearly, 
"Whoever drinks the water I give Him will never thirst." With His atoning death 
on Calvary's holy mountain, He opened the pure and healing fountain that
flows to you, to me, to all...

Now He channels His thirst-quenching forgiveness to us through the riverbeds
of the Word and sacraments. if all who lived on the earth were to come and drink,
never could they drain His forgiveness dry...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, draw me to Your Word and lead me to drink
deeply of the water of life You offer...Amen. 

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6

But like an alcoholic, the more they drink the less their thirst is quenched. Instead of labeling these wells as "unsafe for human consumption, " Satan disguises the spouts to deceive the thirsty traveler. But the time comes when the wells of power, possession, pleasure, and philosophy, where people have let down their buckets of an extravagant life style, will come to find that it is only poison for their soul. There is only one well that can quench the soul's thirst. Jesus said it clearly, "Whoever drinks the water I give Him will never thirst." With His atoning death on Calvary's holy mountain, He opened the pure and healing fountain that flows to you, to me, to all. Now He channels His thirst-quenching forgiveness to us through the riverbeds of the Word and sacraments. if all who lived on the earth were to come and drink, never could they drain His forgiveness dry.
subject: Quench Your Soul's Thirst at Christ's Fountain
verse_text: Whoever drinks the water I give him will never thirst.

01/30/2010~~~food for thought~~~THE BIBLE TELLS ME SO...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
The centurion replied, "Lord, I do not deserve to have You come under my roof.
But just say the word, and my servant will be healed." (Mt. 8:8)

Our Lesson for Today:
What's faith? " A mask for hypocrites," some reply."A wheelchair for weaklings,"
say others. Others say, "Useless foolishness." Others may say, "Its like blind people
chattering about color."

A much more important question, On what does faith rest? The centurion could
answer that question. He wasn't looking for a sign. He didn't even ask Jesus to come
to his house. All he wanted was Christ's promise."Just say the word," he said full
of trust, "and my servant will be healed."

Yes God's Word is the only solid foundation for faith."Jesus loves me, this I know,
for the Bible tells me so," is the only sure song for faith. Because the Bible says so, 
I believe that Jesus paid for my sins with His precious blood and innocent death.

Because Jesus promised, I believe that all who the Spirit brings to faith in Him will 
not perish but have eternal life...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to say with the centurion,
"Just say the Word," and I will be saved...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6

01/31/2010~~~food for thought~~~WHERE HAVE YOU PUT YOUR TRUST???

Our Bible Verse for Today:
They (the disciples) woke Him (Jesus), saying, "Lord, save us!
We're going to drown!" (Mt. 8:25)

Our Lesson for Today:
Are you having trouble falling asleep at night? An elderly gentlemen was asked
how he could fall asleep so fast. His answer was "I just say my prayers to Jesus
out loud and roller over and go to sleep. There is no use in both of us staying awake."
This gentlemen had learned the secret of sleeping through the storms of life.

The disciples had done everything they had learned to do as seamen but to no avail.
their seaman skills did no good. They even were beginning to think that Jesus was
no good as He slept, seemingly unconcerned. How wrong they were!

He had come from heaven to rescue them from the hurricane of sin. He would go to
the cross so that with nail-pierced hands He could invite sin-tossed souls, "Come
to me,...and I will give you rest." (Mt. 11:28)

When such loving, almighty hands are wrapped around the stomas of life, those who sail
with God are safe. Perhaps the disciples didn't roll over and fall asleep the next time
they ran into a storm out on the lake ~ BUT they trusted that their Jesus wasn't sleeping 
either. It's not that we should stop rowing, BUT that we should start trusting Jesus in the 
storms of life...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to trust that there is pardon for all my sins,
in the wounds of Your hands; AND that there is relief in Your 
hands from all of life's storms...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6

Yet, we are reminded that in You, we can lie down and sleep in peace, for You alone, O Lord, make us dwell in safety (Psalm 4:8). Amen.

02/01/2010~~~food for thought~~~"SHINE, JESUS, SHINE"

Our Bible Verse for Today:
He [Jesus] said, "I am the light of the world. Whoever follows Me will
never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life." (Jn. 8:12)

Our Lesson for Today:
Batteries are getting better all the time. But sooner or later they fail. But not so with Jesus.
Like some all-powerful searchlight, He penetrates the dense midnight of sin, pushes aside
the darkness of death, and points the way through earth's gloom to heaven...

Not only does He light the way; He is the way. With His death and resurrection, He paid for sin
and now stands like some well-lit ladder to heaven. With His redemptive work, He's the laser that 
beams us up to eternity...

Jesus stands revealed in Scripture as the lasting light of salvation for all times...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord Jesus, Light of the world, shine upon us, set us 
free by the truth you now bring us...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.

In a world that grows ever darker, we cling to the promise that in Jesus, the light of life shines, and the darkness cannot overcome it. May we walk in the light of Your Son, following His way to the glories of heaven. Amen.
